title: Are Wendy's burgers really made with 100% beef? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is no reflection on the quality of a burger at Wendy’s because I know they are of very good quality but you should be careful using the term “made with”. Take 1/2 lb of good quality ground beef (100% beef). Mix it with 1/4 lb of sawdust. Blend in 1/4 lb water. Press it out into four 1/4 lb “burgers”. The burgers are certainly “made WITH 100% beef” but they are also “made WITH 100% saw dust” and made WITH 100% water. To be just as tricky, you can say “CONTAINS 100% beef” allowing for other ingredients. Thanks to trump’s deregulation of the food industry, sawdust can be represented in so many different ways in the ingredient list. A good quality burger will be “made OF 100% beef” and beef is the only ingredient allowable. “Made using only 100% beef” is also valid.

Wendy’s uses some of the best beef in the industry. First their hamburger meat is never frozen, it is always fresh and it is 100% beef. Some people used to the taste of frozen beef may find Wendy’s not to their liking. Fresh beef has a different flavor from frozen beef and some (much to my surprise) don’t like it.Years ago, beef was delivered to each Wendy’s in 20lb bags and each restaurant made its own patties. This was a process that involved a rather large machine and a very coordinated worker. The machine was not supposed to run continuously and this was a lot harder than it sounds.Nowadays the beef arrives already formed in patties but is still fresh as it can be.By the way American stores get only American beef.
